revised_title: Uricase, Amino Acid Oxidase, and Xanthine Oxidase: Comparative Study and Properties
tldr: This article presents a comparative study of three enzymes: uricase, amino acid oxidase, and xanthine oxidase. The authors describe their main properties, including the effect of various factors on their activity, their reaction with molecular oxygen, and the reduction of hydrogen peroxide. They also examine the enzyme specificity and discuss the role of competitive inhibitors and secondary oxidation of p-phenylenediamine in these reactions.
